title: Romanian fraudster is jailed over ATM scam in Bali
text:
A Romanian man has been jailed in Bali over an ATM scam which copied bank users' personal details.

Alexandru Boarta, 32, was arrested at Badung Regency on the Indonesian party island in March over the scheme.

The Romanian national was sentenced to eight months in prison at the Denpasar District Court on Wednesday.

A Romanian man has been jailed in Bali over an ATM scam that attempted to record people's personal information

'[We] sentence him to eight months in jail and a fine of IDR14 million (AUD$1,463),' presiding judge I Gusti Ngurah Putra Atmaja told the court.



Boarta was found guilty of violating Article 30 of Indonesia's Information and Electronic Transactions Law.

The law prohibits bypassing a digital security system for illegal access to an electronic system, and carries a maximum sentence of eight years in prison, Coconuts reported.

The prosecutor previously called for a one year prison sentence, but Boarta got off a lot lighter.

Boarta had a number of extenuating circumstances that were taken into consideration, including his goof behaviour during trial and a promise not to re-offend.
description: Alexandru Boarta, 32, was arrested at Badung Regency on the Indonesian party island in March for the attempted scheme.
authors: Alana Mazzoni For Daily Mail Australia
